name: Actual Technology
description:
Actual Technology
Zap your way through Actually Additions, unlocking Phantomfaces, Dimensional Transceivers, and Ender IO's Powered Spawner.

quests.name: Shot Hot Spot
quests.description:
All energy relays can wireless transmit power over 15 blocks, and through any material.
The basic relay can transfer 1000 RF/tick.

quests.name: Charge the base
quests.description: Twice the range. Your whole base will be covered!

quests.name: Wand-ering
quests.description:
The Staff of Traveling allows you to teleport a couple blocks forward, at the cost of power.
Do note that you will still suffer from fall damage if you are not careful.

It can also teleport you up to 200 blocks to a Travel Anchor, so long as the Travel Anchor is loaded.

quests.name: Over 9000
quests.description:
Craft an Empowerer and 4 Display Stands! The Display Stands you have crafted must be placed exactly 3 blocks away from the Empowerer along the four cardinal directions.
The Empowerer is a crafting system that consumes power and specialized items from the display stands in a display of light, empowerering the item atop the Empowerer.

quests.name: Vibrant Jetpack
quests.description:
Each tier of jetpack has a higher power storage capacity, faster vertical movement, and faster horizontal movement than the previous. There is no difference in functionality within a tier. You can upgrade a jetpack with armor plating so it will also provide armor to you.
Look at your keybinds for Simply Jetpacks 2 to change the default settings of your jetpack.

IMPORTANT: You can still take fall damage. Tapping space just before you would land cancels this, but may not be doable if there is any amount of lag.


Atricos won't check here, please help I'm trapped and he's forcing me to write some of these! ONLY YOU CAN SAVE ME!

quests.name: Even smarter Item relocator
quests.description: It works similarly to the basic Item Laser Relay, except it now has a GUI that opens when you click it, allowing you to filter input and output items with precision.

quests.name: No power to devour
quests.description:
The Fishing Net is a passive auto-fisher.
To get it to work you'll need to place it above water, and either place an inventory above it for it to eject items into or some type of vacuum to pick up the items it spews onto the ground. No power required!

quests.name: Flux-Infused JetPlate
quests.description:
The Flux-Infused JetPlate can hold up to 50 Million RF, can fly horizontally and vertically even faster than previous jetpacks, gives a large amount of armor, and can change held items. 
Look at your keybinds for Simply Jetpacks 2 to change the default settings of your JetPlate.

IMPORTANT: You can still take fall damage. Tapping space just before you would land cancels this, but may not be doable if there is any amount of lag.

quests.name: It's all the Range nowadays
quests.description: The Range Upgrade can be used on any Laser to increase its range from 15 to 35. The connection uses the distance of the shortest range, so both ends of the Laser will require this Upgrade.

quests.name: Case and Point
quests.description:
Its time to craft an Iron Casing to begin your journey into Actually Additions!

Note: Almost all the recipes in the Actually Additions book are not the actual recipes.

quests.name: Not quite Ethical
quests.description:
Using the Atomic Reconstructor you can convert:
Quartz Block -> Ethetic Quartz
Chiseled Quartz Block -> Ethetic Green Quartz

quests.name: Crystal Allies
quests.description: Alloy up a Vivid Alloy Ingot, Grains of Piezallity, and an Elevatium Ingot to get a wonderful Crystalline Alloy Ingot.

quests.name: Phantom Tandem
quests.description:
Without being bound to a block, Phatomfaces do nothing!
For the low, low price of a Right Click on the target block and a Shift+Right Click on the Phantomface you desire, you can have them actually do something!

quests.name: Energetic Jetpack
quests.description:
Each tier of jetpack has a higher power storage capacity, faster vertical movement, and faster horizontal movement than the previous. There is no difference in functionality within a tier. You can upgrade a jetpack with armor plating so it will also provide armor to you.
Look at your keybinds for Simply Jetpacks 2 to change the default settings of your jetpack.

IMPORTANT: You can still take fall damage. Tapping space just before you would land cancels this, but may not be doable if there is any amount of lag.

quests.name: Shiny bright like a Bundle
quests.description:
You're beatiful, like Bundles in the Sky...

Empower your Crystal Bundle further! Maximum Empowerment!

quests.name: Hardened Jetpack
quests.description:
Each tier of jetpack has a higher power storage capacity, faster vertical movement, and faster horizontal movement than the previous. There is no difference in functionality within a tier. You can upgrade a jetpack with armor plating so it will also provide armor to you.
Look at your keybinds for Simply Jetpacks 2 to change the default settings of your jetpack.

IMPORTANT: You can still take fall damage. Tapping space just before you would land cancels this, but may not be doable if there is any amount of lag.

quests.name: Jakimfett would be proud
quests.description:
The Atomic Reconstructor fires lazers that atomically reconstuct what they hit. This works on multiple stacks of items at once, but requires power for each item converted.
By default, it will auto-fire once every few seconds. Right click with a redstone torch to toggle its activation mode.
The Atomic Reconstructor can alter many items, and it is best to check JEI to get the full list.

quests.name: Better-y than a Capacitor
quests.description: Using your Advanced Coil, craft a Single Battery and upgrade to a Double Battery!

quests.name: Gone Floating
quests.description:
Once, long ago, there was a story about a magical material that could contain near infinite power.
Thats not this material, this one just hovers a bit.

quests.name: Resonant Jetpack
quests.description:
Each tier of jetpack has a higher power storage capacity, faster vertical movement, and faster horizontal movement than the previous. There is no difference in functionality within a tier. You can upgrade a jetpack with armor plating so it will also provide armor to you.
Look at your keybinds for Simply Jetpacks 2 to change the default settings of your jetpack.

IMPORTANT: You can still take fall damage. Tapping space just before you would land cancels this, but may not be doable if there is any amount of lag.

quests.name: Zip Zoop
quests.description:
Link using the Telepad Linking Card. Does not take power, but only teleports players on it when it gets a redstone signal.
Does not work across dimensions.

quests.name: An ever-expanding Chest
quests.description: Craft an Item Interface! This block is capable of interacting with all Chests or other storage devices that have Item Laser Relays connected to them. You can use any pipe that can push or pull into the Item Interface or any connected Chest to wirelessly transfer items between the two. The more Chests connected, the more storage space you can access with the Item Interface. In that sense, it's like an ever-expanding Chest!

quests.name: Return it
quests.description: Bind to a Telepad by Shift+Right Clicking it, and hold Right Click to return to the Telepad. Costs power and Dew of the Void for each operation.

quests.name: Swipe your card
quests.description: Right Click on a QuantumFlux Teleporter to remember it, and Right Click on a different QuantumFlux Teleporter to link them together.

quests.name: Fluxed Thruster
quests.description:
A crafting ingredient.

The other statement is true.

quests.name: Luck is on your side
quests.description:
Craft both tiers of Fortune Augments! To have Fortune Two enabled, you must also have Fortune One.

It works just like normal Fortune, okay?

quests.name: ITS MOB FARM TIME!
quests.description:
The Powered Spawner is an incredibly powerful block, but it takes some effort to use.
First, capture a mob of your choice you want to auto-spawn in a Soul Vial. Then, bind the mob in the Soul Vial to a Broken Spawner through a Soul Binder. Now, combine the rebound Broken Spawner with a Powered Spawner in an anvil. Finally, place the Powered Spawner down, put a capacitor in it (the capacitor will affect the speed and quantity of mobs spawned), and provide it power.
Probably want to do this where the mobs will get automatically killed. Would hate to see another world explode due to an insane amount of mobs.

quests.name: Large Charge Urge
quests.description:
Its time to use the Empowerer to empower your Crystals! Place the Crystal you want to empower on the Empowerer, and the other four items on Display Stands:

- for Redstonia Crystal: Signalum Gear, Redstone Alloy Ingot, Bricks, Infernal Bulb

- for Palis Crystal: Lead Gear, Prismarine Shard, Moonglow Leaf, Enderium Base

- for Void Crystal: Dark Bimetal Gear, Invar Gear, Flint, Charcoal

-for Enori Crystal: Iron Gear, Steel Gear, Snow, Silicon

- fpr Glod Crystal: Lumium Gear, Energized Bimetal Gear, Wildewheat, Blaze Rod

- for Diamantine Crystal: Platinum Gear, Vivid Alloy Ingot, Cloud Berry, Clay

-for Emeraldic Crystal: Vibrant Bimetal Gear, Congealed Slime Block, Spirit Herb, Cactus.

quests.name: Underwater Rest Stops
quests.description:
Travel Anchors are blocks that allow easy teleportation between them by shifting or jumping. They have a maximum range of 100 blocks.
You can change its name and how it appears by Right Clicking on it.
They do not require power for any operation.

quests.name: Leadstone Jetpack
quests.description:
Each tier of jetpack has a higher power storage capacity, faster vertical movement, and faster horizontal movement than the previous. There is no difference in functionality within a tier. You can upgrade a jetpack with armor plating so it will also provide armor to you.
Look at your keybinds for Simply Jetpacks 2 to change the default settings of your jetpack.

IMPORTANT: You can still take fall damage. Tapping space just before you would land cancels this, but may not be doable if there is any amount of lag.

quests.name: Reinforced Jetpack
quests.description:
Each tier of jetpack has a higher power storage capacity, faster vertical movement, and faster horizontal movement than the previous. There is no difference in functionality within a tier. You can upgrade a jetpack with armor plating so it will also provide armor to you.
Look at your keybinds for Simply Jetpacks 2 to change the default settings of your jetpack.

IMPORTANT: You can still take fall damage. Tapping space just before you would land cancels this, but may not be doable if there is any amount of lag.

quests.name: Darkest of Souls
quests.description:
Imbue Soularium with some Dark Steel and a bit of Elevation.

What do you mean you can't?
Fine, just use an ingot of Elevatium.

quests.name: Charge the world
quests.description: You can place one of these on each side of the Enchanced Wireless Charging Antenna, doubling its charging distance in that direction. Cannot be placed on the bottom.

quests.name: Just stick them together
quests.description:
Craft a Crystal Bundle! You might have noticed, that it makes multiple of the same inputs. You'll need to automate this and figure out a way to make the craft always work!

Psst, come here... *filters*, ahem. Filters... Use them.

quests.name: Send it
quests.description:
The Telepad Block is a 3x3 multiblock that consumes power and Dew of the Void to teleport you anywhere. To specify the place, use the resulting Location Printout from using the Coordinate Selector at your desired coordinates. To store more than one place, use the Dialing Device.
This also works as a Travel Anchor.

quests.name: Dark Soularium Thruster
quests.description:
A crafting ingredient.

The other statement is false.

quests.name: Aight. Am smarter now.
quests.description:
When attached to inventories, the Item Laser Relay can see all the items inside.
You can link different Item Laser Relays with 15 blocks of each other together to form a network.
This network will do nothing, however, until you attach it to an Item Interface.

quests.name: Even Better Capacitors
quests.description: The 4th and 5th tiers of capacitors. These can be inserted into any EnderIO machine that accepts capacitors, and greatly buffs its effects, speed, and power capacity.

quests.name: Call it
quests.description: Can store and teleport players to multiple places through the Telepad placed in its range.

quests.name: > Spe- >> Spee- >>> Speeed!
quests.description:
Craft all 3 tiers of Drill Speed Augments! To have Speed Two enabled, you must also have Speed One. The same is true for Speed Three with Speed Two.
Each Speed Augment increases the power usage per block and increases the speed of the Drill. At Speed Three, you instantly mine stone, but consume 400 RF per block mined.

quests.name: Let's face it
quests.description: Craft some specialized versions of the Phantomface! These work the same way, but with Power, Fluids, or Redstone Signal instead.

quests.name: Electrical Steel Jetpack
quests.description:
Each tier of jetpack has a higher power storage capacity, faster vertical movement, and faster horizontal movement than the previous. There is no difference in functionality within a tier. You can upgrade a jetpack with armor plating so it will also provide armor to you.
Look at your keybinds for Simply Jetpacks 2 to change the default settings of your jetpack.

IMPORTANT: You can still take fall damage. Tapping space just before you would land cancels this, but may not be doable if there is any amount of lag.

quests.name: Configuration Commencing!
quests.description:
The Laser Wrench allows you to link Lasers of the same type.
It can also dissconnect, but what monster would want to do that?

quests.name: The Thrill of the Drill
quests.description:
The Drill is a mining tool that mines with the effectiveness of both a Shovel and a Diamond Pickaxe. It uses 100 RF per block mined, and has a number of possible upgrades, including speed and fortune.
Shift+Right Click with the Drill in hand to view your upgrades and upgrade slots.

quests.name: Ender Splendour
quests.description: Allows you to witness the majesty of the end, in block form.

quests.name: Arrange the range
quests.description: Phantom Boosters can be placed on top of a number of blocks, increasing their range for each placed atop it, to a maximum of three.

quests.name: The Tesseract 2: 1.12.2
quests.description: Allows for inter-dimension transportation of power, fluid, and items. Requires a capacitor to function.

quests.name: Dark Soularium JetPlate
quests.description:
The Dark Soularium JetPlate can hold up to 50 Million RF, can fly horizontally and vertically even faster than previous jetpacks, gives a large amount of armor, and can change held items. 
Look at your keybinds for Simply Jetpacks 2 to change the default settings of your JetPlate.

IMPORTANT: You can still take fall damage. Tapping space just before you would land cancels this, but may not be doable if there is any amount of lag.

quests.name: Pew-pew!
quests.description:
Using the Atomic Reconstructor you can convert:
Redstone -> Redstonia Crystal
Lapis -> Palis Crystal
Coal -> Void Crystal
Iron -> Enori Crystal
Gold -> Glod Crystal
Diamond -> Diamantine Crystal
Emerald -> Emeraldic Crystal

quests.name: Conductive Iron Jetpack
quests.description:
Each tier of jetpack has a higher power storage capacity, faster vertical movement, and faster horizontal movement than the previous. There is no difference in functionality within a tier. You can upgrade a jetpack with armor plating so it will also provide armor to you.
Look at your keybinds for Simply Jetpacks 2 to change the default settings of your jetpack.

IMPORTANT: You can still take fall damage. Tapping space just before you would land cancels this, but may not be doable if there is any amount of lag.

quests.name: Works like Silver Shoes
quests.description: The Portable Teleporter is a hand-held device that allows you to teleport to any already existing Teleporter

quests.name: Caveman Eviction
quests.description:
Craft both tiers of Drill Mining Augments! To have 5 by 5 enabled, you must also have 3 by 3.
As expected, 3 by 3 and 5 by 5 increase the mining size of the Drill. They also increase the RF per block cost, and decrease mining speed.
When mining downwards with the 5 by 5, it will only mine one lower, instead of two.
You can hold Shift to only mine one block.

quests.name: Phantom Fandom
quests.description:
The Phantomface works as a remote access point for an inventory within 16 blocks.
Manipulation of items maintains its directionality.
You can place up to three Phantom Boosters on top of the Phantomface to increase its range up to a maximum of 128 blocks.

quests.name: Find it
quests.description:
When using this with a piece of paper in your inventory, it creates a Location Printout, which can then be used in the Telepad or a Dialing Device to teleport to that location.
Make sure to name it something that you will understand later.

quests.name: Charge the room
quests.description:
Charges players within 24 blocks in every direction. Right Click to show its range in-world.

No, you cannot use it to shock someone else.

quests.name: Rollup goldrub
quests.description: Not all the glitters is Glod...

quests.name: Not your father's portal!
quests.description:
The Mekanism Teleporter is a 4x3 mulitblock structure, with the Teleporter block in the middle on the bottom, and a hollow 2x1 in the middle for the player to walk though.
It works like the channel system you are familiar with in the rest of Mekanism, and requires power.

quests.name: Worry not: Items on the way!
quests.description:
If the player that placed the Player Interface down is within 32 blocks, Power can be inserted into the block to charge items in the players inventory, and items can be inserted and extracted, starting with the hotbar.
You can place up to three Phantom Boosters on top of the Player Interface to increase its range up to a maximum of 256 blocks.

quests.name: Even Better Conduits
quests.description: These conduits will allow you to transfer even more power!

quests.name: Roll it up!
quests.description: Wrap some Crystaline Brown Slime Ingots around your new Enori Crystal - who knows what it will make?

quests.name: Mmhhhm, chunky
quests.description:
The Experience Solidifier can turn your experience into solidified lumps of goo.
You can consume this Solidified Experience by Right Clicking it, and can consume a whole stack if you also hold Shift.
Though seeing as you've already been rewarded quite a lot of this stuff, you probably know how to use it.
Though with this machine you can automate the creation of this goo and use it to empower some Crystal Bundles!

quests.name: Fully Shot-graded
quests.description:
Upgrade your Energy Laser Relay all the way to the Extreme variant! All Energy Relays can wirelessly transmit power over 15 blocks, and through any material.
The Advanced relay can transfer 10,000 RF/tick.
The Extreme Relay can transfer 100,000 RF/tick.

quests.name: Put down the Drill
quests.description: Craft a Block Placing Augment for the Drill! Before inserting this upgrade into the Drill, Right Click with it. When inside the Drill, Right Clicking with the Drill will attempt to place any block that is in that slot of your hotbar. Now you'll never need to stop holding your beloved Drill!
